description: {"blocks":[{"key":"stqm","text":"This protocols describe how to perform CUT\u0026RUN on human brain tissue (frozen)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Aligning Science Across Parkinson’s through the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"92ku","text":"Sample   -   from human brain tissue and store at   until use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":11,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"304ee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"6E8AE1B0A6CF11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"6EF46E60A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"780F5D20A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p2q9","text":"Activate ConA-coat magnetic beads (Epicypher) by washing twice in bead binding buffer [20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 10 mM KCl, 1 mM CaCl, 1 mM MnCl2]. Place on ice until use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":138,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nf6u","text":"Isolate nuclei from frozen tissue after incubating with Recombinant Alexa Fluor® 488 Anti-NeuN antibody [EPR12763] - Neuronal Marker (ab190195) at a concentration of 1:500 for 30 minutes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":33}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dv70","text":"Run nuclei through the FACS at   with low flowrate using a 100 mm nozzle and isolate 300.000 nuclei Alexa Fluor – 488 positive nuclei. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cn6g1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"429F4207278F11ED9BA60A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.5jyl8j678g2w/v1"}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8761F0D0A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhetb","text":"Pellet the sorted nuclei at 1,300 x g for   and resuspend in   of ice-cold nuclear wash buffer (20 mM HEPES, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1x cOmplete protease inhibitors, 0.1% BSA) and   per antibody treatment of ConA-coated magnetic beads (Epicypher) added with gentle vortexing (Pipette tips for transferring nuclei were pre-coated with 1% BSA). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":188,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"uce0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"933E97A0A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"8CFB32E0A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"A9DCB140A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1if0","text":"Bind nuclei to beads for   at RT with gentle rotation, and then split bead-bound nuclei into three equal volumes (corresponding to IgG control, H3K4me3 and H3K9me3 treatments). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c7ns2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"B480FF20A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4b5oq","text":"Remove wash buffer and resuspend nuclei in   cold nuclear antibody buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 0.15 M NaCl, 0.5 mM Spermidine, 1x Roche complete protease inhibitors, 0.02% w/v digitonin, 0.1% BSA, 2 mM EDTA) containing primary antibody at 1:50 dilution and incubate at     with gentle shaking. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":269,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":271,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c0osg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"BA456FE0A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C0D98CB0A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"C241A830A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4a7p","text":"Wash nuclei thoroughly with nuclear digitonin wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM Spermidine, 1x Roche cOmplete protease inhibitors, 0.02% digitonin, 0.1% BSA) on the magnetic stand. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"215g6","text":"After the final wash, add pA-MNase in nuclear digitonin wash buffer and incubate with the nuclei at   for  . Wash nuclei twice, resuspend in   digitonin buffer, and chill to   -  in a metal block sitting in wet ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":100,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":106,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":141,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":174,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":177,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4t0md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CDA9BB40A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"CF741B00A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"D2691810A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DCF37550A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"0","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DEFA1AC0A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"2","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dum5","text":"Stimulate genome cleavage by addition of 2 mM CaCl2 at 0 ºC for 30 min. Quench the reaction by additing   2x stop buffer (0.35 M NaCl, 20 mM EDTA, 4 mM EGTA, 0.02% digitonin, 50 ng/µL glycogen, 50 ng/µL RNase A, 10 fg/µL yeast spike-in DNA) and vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":50,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"20oiu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"E3D84A30A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8a55e","text":"Incubate   at   to release genomic fragments. Place bead-bound nuclei on the magnet stand and purify fragments from the supernatant using a NucleoSpin clean-up kit (Macherey-Bagel). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3c4pk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"E93DAB00A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"EBA84260A6CE11ED80040763F386D207","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84uf3","text":"Prepare Illumina sequencing libraries using the Hyperprep kit (KAPA) with unique dual-indexed adapters (KAPA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
